repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

comment_data.body: The generated C code lacks error handling everywhere. Could you please add that?
I think it's worth giving a name to `splitext(x)[0]`. And also to `x`, e.g. `file_name`.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -29,7 +29,20 @@ if options.output:
     old_stdout = sys.stdout
     sys.stdout = open(options.output, 'w')
 
-modules = [basename(splitext(x)[0]).replace('.', '_') for x in args]
+packages=[]
+modules=[]
+fullNames=[]
+
+for x in args:
+    moduleName=basename(splitext(x)[0]).replace('.', '_')
+    fullName=splitext(x)[0].replace(".", "_").replace("/", ".")

comment_data.body: Why is `__path__` set to an empty tuple here?

comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -29,7 +29,20 @@ if options.output:
     old_stdout = sys.stdout
     sys.stdout = open(options.output, 'w')
 
-modules = [basename(splitext(x)[0]).replace('.', '_') for x in args]
+packages=[]
+modules=[]
+fullNames=[]
+
+for x in args:
+    moduleName=basename(splitext(x)[0]).replace('.', '_')
+    fullName=splitext(x)[0].replace(".", "_").replace("/", ".")

commit.message:
Handle subpackages

This change allows to include subpackages in  executables created with cython_freeeze. It does only handle simple cases (ie it does not handle identical module names or __init__.py).

committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1655827510 +0200

Handle subpackages

This change allows to include subpackages in  executables created with cython_freeeze. It does only handle simple cases (ie it does not handle identical module names or __init__.py).
